course_title: Spec Topics: History: Race/Ethnicity in US South
seats: Seats: Maximum Enrollment: 24 / Seats Avail: 16Waitlist Total: 0
class_notes: (Same as AMST 385 5) This course explores the history of the U.S. South as it intersects with questions of race, ethnicity, and migration. Readings will take us chronologically and thematically from the mid 19th through early 21st centuries as we place the South in conversation with the (trans)national processes that would come to diversify the region. Throughout the semester we will consider how race, ethnicity, and migration specifically have shaped the region in relation to labor, politics, culture, and historical memory.
course_description: Selected topics in history for advanced students. May be repeated for credit when topic varies.
schedule_location: TTh 10am-11:15am in Math & Science Center - N304
